title: A simpler method for learning to control a robot
summary: Researchers from MIT and Stanford University have developed a new machine-learning approach that could improve the control of robots, such as drones and autonomous vehicles, in dynamic environments. The approach incorporates structure from control theory into the learning process, allowing the system to learn effective controllers more efficiently. By learning the system's dynamics and control-oriented structures from data, the researchers can create controllers that perform better in real-world scenarios. The technique also requires less data than other approaches, making it more efficient in rapidly changing environments. The researchers believe their approach could be applied to various types of dynamical systems in the future.
